newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela to decide if Pepsi has case in cola war.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela to decide if Pepsi has case in cola war.

text.p: Venezuela is to decide Friday afternoon whether to proceed with PepsiCo Inc's charge that Coca-Cola Co's position in Venezuela is monopolistic, government officials said.
"There'll be a decision this afternoon," said a spokeswoman at Venezuela's Superintendency to Protect and Promote Free Competition (Procompetencia).
Pepsi complained to Procompetencia on Monday that Coke's new deal with Venezuela's largest bottler created a monopoly, preventing freedom of choice in the local soft drinks market.
If Procompetencia finds in Pepsi's favor, a final ruling will be delivered in 60 days. Pepsi officials have said a positive decision could lead to Coke plants bottling Pepsi.
The legal action follows a surprise defection by the former Pepsi bottler, Grupo Cisneros Embotelladoras de Venezuela, to Coke.
